mission_task_and_description: HHT TRAIP – M4 / M249 QUALIFICATION (04 JAN 23) – RANGE 102

subtasks.hazard: COLLISION WITH MILITARY OR CIVILIAN VEHICLES

values: HHT TROOP WILL MOVE IN PLATOON‑SIZED ELEMENTS (≈ 8‑12 vehicles) AT 50‑100 m INTERVALS TO MINIMIZE COLLISION POTENTIAL.
ALL VEHICLES WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH FM‑RADIO AND MAINTAIN CONTINUOUS RADIO CONTACT.
CONVOY WILL OPERATE IN ACCORDANCE WITH SQDN SOP ON VEHICLE CONTROL (VC) AND REAR‑GUARD AWARENESS.
CONVOY SAFETY BRIEF, RAMP BRIEF, RADIO CALL‑SIGN SOP
Convoy Commander (1LT Moore), Vehicle Controllers, RSO, All Squad Leaders
ALL EQUIPMENT WILL BE SECURED WITH TIE‑DOWN LASHES, CHOCKS, AND COVERS.
LEADERS WILL PERFORM A “HAND‑ON” CHECK OF SENSITIVE ITEMS BEFORE DEPARTURE.
POST‑MOVE INVENTORY WILL BE COMPLETED AT THE OBJECTIVE.
PCC/PCI CHECKS, INVENTORY SHEET
Truck NCOIC, Squad Leaders, RSO
DRIVER FATIGUE BRIEF WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE CONVOY SAFETY BRIEF.
LEADERS WILL MONITOR DRIVER ALERTNESS AND WILL ROTATE DRIVERS AS NEEDED.
REST PLAN ESTABLISHED – DRIVERS WILL TAKE a 15‑minute break every 2 hours of travel.
SAFETY BRIEF, RAMP BRIEF, LEADERSHIP MONITORING
OIC, RSO, Platoon Leaders
AMMUNITION WILL BE ISSUED ONLY PRIOR TO LANE ENTRY.
UPON LANE COMPLETION, EACH SOLDIER WILL PASS THROUGH A DESIGNATED CHOKE POINT WHERE ALL ROUNDS ARE TURNED IN TO THE ASP NCOIC.
WEAPON‑MAGAZINE INSPECTION WILL BE CONDUCTED AT THE CHOKE POINT.
SAFETY BRIEF, PCC/PCI, CHOKE POINT PROCEDURES
RSO, ASP NCOIC, Lane Safeties, All Soldiers
ENFORCE SELECTOR‑SAFE DISCIPLINE – WEAPONS MUST BE ON SAFE UNTIL TARGET ACQUIRED.
POST‑ENGAGEMENT, SELECTOR SWITCHES RETURNED TO SAFE.
SPOT‑CHECKS WILL BE PERFORMED BY LANESAFETIES EVERY 5 MINUTES.
SAFETY BRIEF, CONTINUOUS SPOT‑CHECKS
RSO, Lane Safeties, Squad Leaders

subtasks.hazard: RICHOCHET / WEAPON ORIENTED OTHER THAN DOWN‑RANGE

values: FULL DRAGOON STANDARD UNIFORM (including ballistic vest) WILL BE WORN ON THE FIRING LINE.
MUZZLE DISCIPLINE BRIEF – WEAPONS MUST ALWAYS POINT DOWN‑RANGE.
RANGE CONSTRUCTION WILL INCLUDE BACKSTOP MARKINGS TO VISUALLY CONFIRM DOWN‑RANGE ORIENTATION.
SAFETY BRIEF, RANGE CONSTRUCTION, 1:1 COACHING
RSO, Lane Safeties, All Shooters
IF WILDLIFE IS OBSERVED, SHOOTERS MUST CALL CEASE‑FIRE IMMEDIATELY.
RSO WILL CONFIRM AREA CLEAR BEFORE RESUMING FIRE.
NO INTERACTION WITH WILDLIFE ALLOWED.
SAFETY BRIEF, RSO WILDLIFE PROCEDURES
OIC, RSO, All Soldiers
IMMEDIATE ACTION DRILL WILL BE EXECUTED FOLLOWED BY REMEDIAL ACTION.
IF MALFUNCTION PERSISTS, LEVEL‑20 ARMORERS WILL BE CALL‑ED TO INSPECT THE WEAPON.
MALFUNCTION INCIDENTS WILL BE LOGGED FOR AFTER‑ACTION REVIEW.
SAFETY BRIEF, LANESAFETY IMMEDIATE‑ACTION DRILL
RSO, Lane Safeties, On‑site Armorers
RSO WILL WALK THE RANGE WITH LANESAFETIES TO POLICE ALL BRASS.
100 % OF AMMUNITION MUST BE TURNED IN BEFORE RANGE CLEARANCE.
SAFETY BRIEF, BRASS POLICING PROCEDURE
RSO, Lane Safeties, ASP NCOIC
WEATHER BRIEF WILL COVER SIGNS OF HEAT‑STROKE, HYPOTHERMIA, AND FROSTBITE.
UNIFORM STANDARD WILL BE ENFORCED – DRAGoon Uniform WITH INTEGRATED COLD‑WEATHER GEAR FOR MORNING/EVENING PEAKS.
MEDIC WILL CONDUCT PERIODIC CHECK‑INS ON ALL PERSONNEL.
WEATHER BRIEF, MEDIC CHECK‑INS
OIC, RSO, Medic (SPC Mandujano), Squad Leaders
HANGFIRE PROCEDURE WILL BE FOLLOWED – KEEP WEAPON POINTED DOWN‑RANGE UNTIL SAFE.
MISFIRED ROUND WILL BE SEPARATED AND TURNED IN AS MISFIRE.
LANE SAFETIES WILL VERIFY CLEAR AREA BEFORE RESUMING FIRE.
SAFETY BRIEF, HANGFIRE/MISFIRE SOP
Lane Safeties, RSO, All Shooters
OPERATE IN ACCORDANCE WITH CURRENT COVID‑19 SOPs.
MAINTAIN SOCIAL DISTANCING (≥6 FT) WHILE MOVING BETWEEN LANES.
UNVACCINATED PERSONNEL WILL WEAR FACE‑COVERINGS AT ALL TIMES.
HAND‑SANITIZER STATIONS WILL BE AVAILABLE EVERY 30 M AND SURFACES WILL BE SANITIZED EVERY TWO HOURS.
COVID‑19 BRIEF, CONTINUOUS MONITORING
OIC, RSO, All Leaders

overall_supervision_plan: The OIC (1LT Moore) and the RSO (SSG Zagal) will conduct an initial safety and range orientation immediately following range occupation.  All squad leaders will coach shooters 1:1 on the lane with lane safeties maintaining a 1:1 ratio.  The RSO will continuously monitor ammunition turn‑in, weapon malfunctions, wildlife sightings, and weather‑related hazards.  Any newly identified risk will be captured in a risk register, mitigated on‑spot, and escalated for higher‑level risk acceptance as required.  Every Soldier is designated a “personal safety” and is empowered to call “cease‑fire” should an unsafe condition arise.  The supervision plan remains a living document and will be updated throughout the event.
